description: I'm digging this reasonably priced temple of beer geekdom. Friendly staff, good range of beers both on tap and in cans. Not especially comfortable seating, and the back is punishingly loud, though there are board games. Friendly staff. No IPAs on tap? Huh.
author: Nick C.

description:
Used to think this place was cool but just tried going into grab some take-away beer and because we had our baby with us the bartender immediately, and very condescendingly, told us we can't have babies inside and proceeded to openly mock us in front of other customers.  We didn't sit at the bar, we didn't order a drink... we went right to the fridge and looked at the beer menu. Apparently doing that with a baby is enough to get the bartenders to talk shit about you.

So be warned, this place doesn't like new parents..
author: Andrew S.

description: Excellent beer choices. Both on tap and bottles. Reasonable prices for draught beers and hey, the place is pretty nice too. I definitely recommend this taproom.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
For all my San Jose yelpers, Liquid Gold in SF is the equivalent to ISO beers or Market Beer Shop.

Found this spot after a morning of hiking. We were looking to kick back and enjoy some beers after eating, and Liquid Gold did just that for us. The parking situation isn't ideal since it's located on a busy big street, so do your best to find street parking nearby on the cross street or a few blocks away...or you can always take public transportation or Lyft! 

The beer selection is very diverse and expansive. We both went with the tasters because there were too many beers for us to take our picks in pints. There are a bit of everything--barrel-aged, sours, stouts, pilsners, New England ales--you name it they practically had it! Our beertender was going solo that afternoon, but service was still courteous and he got the job done. Thanks good sir. I enjoyed how he was not judgmental about the selection of my beers, and he so graciously allowed me to sample the beers I were unsure about before committing to some tasters. Quality man, thank you!

Ambiance has got a cool and relaxed lounge vibe without the loud and trashy music. There's a edgy rocker spirit to Liquid Gold, probably because of the cool overhead gold lamps and the suave bar stools. There are other seating arrangements at the entryway and one bigger table at the end of the bar near the restroom. There is also a fridge stocked full of beers if you're in the mood to take some solid burrs home after a visit in this taproom. 100% will highly recommend coming here for beer snobs and newbs.
author: Jodi H.

description: Over 30 beers/ciders on tap and hundreds of bottles & cans available. Solid section for all. Most drinks are standard $7-$10. Simplistic vibe and a welcoming ambiance. Will be going back!
author: Mitch B.

description:
Beer bars are a dime a dozen in the West Bay these days, and a lot of them are upping the game with serious food offerings too. While Liquid Gold doesn't serve food, it's nevertheless one of my favorite West Bay venues for a brew - or two, three, four, or more - because it has an extensive, well-curated, constantly rotating array of offerings from up and down the West Coast. 

On that note, you can indeed kick back and enjoy lots of brews because they do tasting flights here (take that, Beer Hall). Best of all, you can compose your own flights, and the bartenders here are super happy to work with you in forming your choices. Great beers (lots of them, in fact) and great service - what's not to love?
author: Vincent L.

description: A chill, non-crowded place to bring your pupper and enjoy some great beers! We stopped here on a late Friday night and appreciated the friendly service and the unique assortment of brews to choose from. Looking forward to coming back!
author: Stacy K.

description:
I loved visiting this beer bar during my trip! They have a very well-organized menu that breaks up their beers into their types/flavors which I always appreciate. They let you try the beers before buying them or making you get a flight, which is also a plus! 

We grabbed the couch so we could watch the basketball game comfortably. They have tons of games such as Connect 4, Battleship, Cards Against Humanity, etc. Liquid Gold also has a fridge in the back filled with bottled beers and ciders that you can buy for a small extra opening fee, I think about a dollar.
author: Sereena J.

description:
Had a beer here before a show at the Masonic. Well, had a flight, I should say. Really appreciated that I could choose any beers for my flight. I'm a stout fan so when I'm forced into an IPA or anything else, really, just so I can get that last selection in the flight of a stout, it ticks me off.

They do a good job of keeping beers rotating in, which you can watch on their live board, as happened when they ran out of one stout and replaced it with another. There wasn't any whale-of-a-stout that night, but it was just mid-November, so I would hope for more interesting offerings to come soon.

The service was fine - friendly, to be sure, but not gonna be besties with anyone working here. The atmosphere is also just fine - not spectacular - just fine. You're not gonna hang forever here - you'll be in and out.
author: Laurie H.

description:
Walked in to purchase beer to go (they have a fridge) at 7.42 pm Sunday, and this quasi hipster wannabe guy says we're "closed" . 
Boss, your website says you close at 8 on Sundays. Get your timings straight!
There were probably 10 drinking at the bar by the way.

A neighborhood client looked up your timings, made effort to walk to you (with 18 mins to spare) to spend quick $50 to grab beer to go, let you know it's just to go, and you didn't have the decency to do your basic job for which you're being paid? Probably service industry isn't for you man. Stop losing your owner money and the bar it's reputation. Am gonna ask friends in the hood to start avoiding this place.
author: DJ R.

description: Favorite beer bar in sf! Great central location with long list of constantly rotating taps. I love the long bar with plenty of bar stools but there's also a few tables. It's not a huge place yet it somehow is always the perfect balance of busy and not too busy when I go. Added bonus of being dog friendly!
author: Daniela J.

description: Looking for a place to get a quick beer (or two, or three) before meeting up for dinner I asked my son for a recommendation close to our hotel and we ended up at Liquid Gold. Not crowded on a Tuesday afternoon and the bartender was friendly and knowledgeable. Great selection of beers for my flight and a good start on my "new beer" list for this vacation. Got a recommendation for a breakfast place (Mymy) and they also have wine, which pleased my very patient wife. This going to be a GREAT vacation!
author: Dave W.

description: Liquid Gold is a beautiful place. I go here probably at least once a month because it's so consistently good (and conveniently close to where I live). Regularly updated beer menu with around 30 options on draft. I highly recommend doing a flight - I can never choose just one option. They do a fantastic job of keeping their menu balanced, with options ranging from lagers to IPAs to porters. Lots of local and small breweries are represented. I love coming here because I always get to try something new or seasonal. And plus, it's a bit of a hidden gem, so it's rarely crazy crowded (but still crowded enough that you know it's a great spot!).
author: Megan B.

description: Awesome selection of tap and bottles and cans. So.good for the neighborhood! No kitchen but you can bring your own food.
author: Eric C.

description:
YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2017: 8/100.

THIRD OF FIVE SPOTS FOR NYE! 

Hubbers and I continued our quest for random NYE bar stops and decided to walk up this street from O'Farrell. Whoa, those hills! Hubbers and I certainly felt like we had a workout of some sort! 

We walked by this place, did a double take, stopped, then decided, "Eh. Why not?!" 

I let Hubbers decide on our drinks. 

It was a good change from the first couple of spots we went to. There wasn't a crowd and it was pretty chill. I guess you can say this was our eye of the (NYE BARHOP) storm. 

There's a fridge at the back with all kinds of wine and beer if nothing catches your attention on their menu. 

We took our time because our next stop was a few more hills away. 

It's a good kickback place if you happen to be looking for one.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Beer, what you tryin to do? 
24 karat liquid gold magic in the air
Head to toe beer player
Look out look out 

Pop pop try a sample
A beer sample
Guess who's soon going back again? 
Oh they don't know? 
Oh they don't know? 
I bet they know as soon as I walk back in 
Sampling the hemly pear cider
Bohemian nectar
Nob Hill's finest booze
I only had two drinks wanted to watch myself
I was picky when I had to choose 

(sung to the lyrics of "24 karat magic" by Bruno Mars). 

I live in Marin but have next to no exposure to hipster beer bars in SF (yes, I have been to them in LA but LA is not known for hipster beer bars, SF definitely is) so I was not sure what to expect here. 

My friend talked up liquid gold and was he right? Yes he was. I tried the pear cider and it was pretty good although I still prefer apple cider. My friend had some guinness (I prefer the pale ales, the ciders and the stellas over dark beer and I sometimes view dark beer the same way I view keystone light) and I tried a little bit. Again, I do not like dark beers. I stuck with my cider and my bohemian nectar, one glass each. They went together well. 

Overall, this is a strong place (with strong beer) and definitely exemplifies the hipster beer bar that everyone idealizes. The chalkboard with the menu? Check. The little corners and couches? Check. The sleek but not pretentious look? Check. 

The cider could have been a bit better but it is enough to get four stars. 24 karat liquid gold magic is in the air.
author: Alec W.

description:
Came on Friday around 4pm, it wasn't too crowded and everyone was super nice. Bartenders, patrons, everyone!

I wasn't sure what I wanted, which can be overwhelming at a beer bar...But the bartender was able to help me figure out a good pick. $1 of beers during happy hour too, definitely can't complain!

Restrooms are nice and clean and service is super attentive. What more can you ask for?
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Good beer up the hill!

A friend suggested we meet at Liquid Gold for a beer or two. Coming from the Financial District side, I was a bit pissed about the fact that I had to climb up the hill to get there, but once I got there my mood changed quickly. The place is small, but inviting. The bar is a good size and the menu gives you plenty of options. I tried Kern River's Hop Nookie just because it said "Triple IPA" under it! Well, I can't say if I enjoyed it 3 times more than other IPAs, but it sure was good and felt good going down too! After the 11% alcohol buzz, I decided I need to take it easy for my second round and Pine Street's Green Thumb which is a Rosemary pale ale and only 5%! Good decision! Another good beer!

If you are ever walking that way and feel like a brew, stop for one; you won't be sorry you did :-)
author: Afshin A.

description:
I hope no one ever finds out about this place because I want it all to myself.  I love that it's never too packed. AND there is a wideeee selection of beer (almost too wide, because I always want to try them all). You can even get beer floats with humphrey slocumbe ice cream!! 

This is such a hidden gem. :) SHHHHh
author: Angela L.

description:
Liquid Gold is a nice little craft beer spot in an area where I don't visit much. It being so close to Polk I didn't really expect much. 

Kind of small and dark, they have a pretty diverse bottle selection in the way back that's nicely sorted by beer type. There's also a decent selection of local brews on tap. I've been seeing more and more Bay Area brews on taps around the city so it's  good to see that diversity. It was quiet when we were there so we just settled down with our beers and had a nice game of Battleship. 

Chill neighborhood craft beer bar. If I lived in the area it'd probably be my go to spot. 

What made my experience so GREAT though was that the back was filled with kegs and boxes of beer. Why is this great you ask?? I'll tell you why. 

For the first time in years, I managed to get my hands on a CASE of Goose Island Bourbon County Stout. I've tried looking for it in Chicago, I've tried looking for it around the city and I've never been lucky enough though maybe I haven't tried hard enough shrug. Oh, I've had it on taps during beer week etc. but never actual bottles! I saw the boxes against the wall behind me and asked the bartender and he casually said yeah, the boxes are full. And the surprising thing was that there were no limits on the number of bottles I could purchase! So ultimately, I walked in for a beer and walked out with a case. It was a good night. =D
author: Liza X.

description: Name says it all liquid GOLD!!! Fresh, cold and fucking delicious with the side of great atmosphere! A must for a beer lover!
author: Pavel K.

description:
This brand spankin' new beer bar on Hyde is the perfect addition to Russian Hill. Right across the street from Trader Joe's, it's a great spot to get your fix of bourgeoise brews. Their take-aways are outstanding (sours galore) and the environment is exactly what I'd create if I had $$ and a knack for starting my own business.

Two friends and I enjoyed dominos and sour beers on a crowded Wednesday during SF Beer Week. The bartenders were helpful in recommending beers (even though the taps were guest taps), the ambiance was laid back and cool, and the beers were next level.

I'd merit Liquid Golf 5*s if they had a few snacks to go along with their beers. It wasn't clear if you can bring in outside food, but it'd be a huge plus.
author: Kerry G.

description: great place to grab a casual beer. They have so many options so I am sure everyone can find something they like. It was a little pricey but I guess that is to be expected in SF. They also have some bottles and cans in the back and some awesome growlers for purchase. Will definitely be back to try some more beer!
author: Rachel N.

description: Never knew this place existed until now! Great beer spot. Very sleek and modern ambiance with a giant selection of take home beers in the back. They have a long bar with a few tables in front, couch and bigger table in the back with board games. We came hear during the end of SF beer week so they had all local Bay Area brews. I had a really great sour and a wheat beer (from Epidemic Ale in concord). Really great place and will definitely be back!
author: Alex S.

description:
Review for Friday, 6p. Quick drink before dinner.
- Nice and chill place
- sat at the bar (usually that's where to best service is)
- I had 3 flights (wheat beer, mint stout and chocolate coffee stout)
- husband had 4 flights, mostly IPAs

Would definitely come here again; not pretentious. Very chill place and quiet enough (when we went on a Friday night) to hang out.

Beers were from Altamont, Sierra Nevada, Drakes, Ballast Point, Fieldwork.
author: Mary H.

description: Definitely a cool spot with lots of great rotating craft beers and also beers for purchase. We came here on a Friday night and it was busy, but definitely a cool vibe place!
author: Paul A.

description: Tim Lee was an awesome host. We were visiting from Bend, Or and he provided us with some aweome food recommendations and just made us feel at home. Solid beer on tap and a good beer selection. I was able to pick up a four pack of some fresh IPA from Alvarado brewing. Highly recommended this place.
author: Rudy L.

description: Great hidden gem of a bar that serves over 30 beers on tap and even has some wine on tap as well. Is usually not too busy and nice to sit at the bar. it's a good place to meet up with friends and catch up.
author: Young Y.

description: Awesome beer bar with great beer. Tim, you would benefit from hiring female bartenders to balance the gender ratio.
author: Roland L.

description: So the guy gave me the wrong beer and wouldn't give me another one.....so screw this place
author: daniel w.

description:
30 beers on tap. That's good beer at that. 

Stumbled on Liquid Gold a few months back and it's a lovely spot to grab a pint and discover some new brewskis while you're at it. Tried some new pints from dependable brewers like St. Archer and Half Moon Bay but also was pleasantly surprised by the the blood orange gose that was like a wheat ale with citrus tartness and a slight pinch of saltiness. 

They have happy hour plus you can also get flights of beers (1-5 beers at $3/5oz for most beers sans a few) to increase your sampling pleasure here. Service is friendly and you'll meet local regulars at happy hour time. Not much for food except some popcorn but feel free to have beer for dinner.  

Definitely worth a stop in if you enjoy your beers since Liquid Gold rotates their taps. Yes... rotating 30 taps.
author: Jon L.

description: Cool little bar that sells craft beers the bartenders are nice and although they close at 10pm, it's all good so you don't stay out too drunk.
author: N A.

description:
I am guilty of taking my beer a little too seriously, and my friends do too. So we're always excited when new places open up. I've given this Liquid Gold a few chances, and a dinner conversation last night made me realize I shouldn't give them more business.
It's a pretty male dominated culture, and all my serious beer ladies are used to from time to time not being taken seriously by the neckbeards. But repeatedly getting poor treatment by a chick sets a new low. And it's not just me. Everyone I know (every beer loving girl that is) has been poorly treated by the female beertender (co-owner?) there. My boyfriend and I arrived at different times once, and even he noticed the major difference in how we were treated.
SF has enough good places to not spend $ where we're not welcome.
It's a shame, as their taplist and bottles usually are top notch. But it turns out we are quite a few who're not going there anymore because of similar experiences.
author: Kat B.

description: Great service, and an oh-so deep selection of craft beers. Very laidback staff and friendly clientele.
author: Al K.

description:
This bar is in my friend's 'hood and have made a stop the last two times when i've been lucky enough to visit the northern part of the Golden State. She knows I'm a craft beer gal (former San Diegan) and knew this would be up my alley. Good instincts on my friend's part. The ambiance of the bar is a little trendy, but not overrun by hipsters or bros. Feels like a local watering hole with decent lighting where you can catch a game, sample a lot of beers, or play some board games on the long patio table in the back of the bar. 

Their beer selection is pretty well curated, as I've been able to enjoy some San Diego County favorites, and discover some new Northern California beers. I really like that they offered a tasting tray option, where you can get a 5oz pour of four different beers. I have beer ADD and a millennial so this allows me to try all the beers without committing to a whole pint. 

If you're wanting to just grab a bomber or sixer to go, they have a decent selection of beers from around the country. I noticed most of the popular San Diego breweries represented, including Alesmith, Ballast Point, Stone, and Modern Times. There is no food, but if you're hungry there are a lot of great little casual and more upscale places to eat in any direction you go to or from here. 

I'm sure i'll be back to grab a pint again when I return to the Bay Area in March. Check it out if you find yourself in Nob Hill.
author: Rebecca T.

description: Kind of a hole in the wall place but the selection on tap is amazing! Visiting SF from LA and have the say we had more of these down in SoCal!
author: Evan H.

description: Located in Nob Hill, Liquid Gold is a unique bar. They have a uniquely curated selection of beers. My friend got the strawberry beer, oatmeal beer by McKellar, and a New Belgium beer. I had a guava soda because I don't really like alcohol. It was $3. The bartenders are nice and the interior is nice. A fun place to hang out at.
author: Denise C.

description:
Really great place to hang and drink quality, quality beer from a truly awesome selection. 

They must have had 15-20 beers on tap and 4-5 floor to ceiling fridges in the back filled with a delicious, diverse selection of beers from the basic to the rich & famous. 

Can get a little crowded here but for good reason. This place is a beer man's heaven - come here and find your own pot of gold --- and keep filling 'er up!
author: David J.

description: Incredible selection and even better staff. Adding this to the regular rotation. Check out their beer week events!
author: E E.

description:
This place has an awesome vibe to it that you don't find at many places in SF. We came here on a Friday at around 6 for drinks after work and I was surprised to see that the place wasn't overly crowded with people. We were able to get a table (they use whiskey barrels which are awesome) for the 5 of us, and the bar was about half full.

The greatest thing about Liquid Gold is definitely their great selection of beers on tap. There were about 30 different beers as well as wine and cider. They've also got beer flights at $3 per 5oz pour. Most of their beers run at a 12oz pour between $5-10 which is awesome.

If you like craft beer or want to like craft beer, then this is the place to go!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I am so sad Liquid Gold didn't exist when I lived 2 short blocks away! But at least now whenever I come back to SF to meet up with friends, I know the best place to go for great beer. This place has a beer list that will make you weak in the knees. On each of my visits, I have had the pleasure of trying amazing beers from all over the country. I'm a fan of beers on the heavier side, 7-10%, and Liquid Gold has that well covered. I love saisons, porters, and IPAs and have found a few new great ones since visiting. 

If you're in the mood for a beer, don't go to any ol bar where you will be stuck choking down the average pilsner or IPA that can be found in almost every other bar. Come here and have a life changing beer instead! Also, the space has really cool industrial/modern look, the staff are all very friendly, and the bathroom is kept clean!
author: Kristen R.

description:
They have a great selection of craft beer on tap and they have a well stocked fridge so you can purchase drinks to go.  Even though beer is their specialty, they do have wine for those of you who want something else, however the selection isn't as extensive.

Food  - they serve food (from next door) and it's not peanuts, crackers, or pretzels!  We had fried tofu and 2 plates of chicken wings with a side of hot sauce. yum.

Prices - I think their beer and wine is priced fairly well and competitively with other places in the area.  Remember, this isn't a dive bar....
author: Angelica C.

description:
We have been anxiously awaiting the opening of Liquid Gold.  I have to admit, I thought it might be a bit more pretentious than it turned out to be - I keep forgetting that we are SF, and we are a welcoming culture.  This is a good beer-centric Tap Room that is focusing on diversity and novelty..  30 Brews On-Tap, and a good range of selections.

I like the lay-out of the space.  There is a deep space that has good flow.  There is room for a few people to a good-sized crowd as it get's more popular.

Their service was excellent.  I went off of recommendations for my 4-Beer Flight.  All good.  There is a good vibe here - it is born out of a love for beer and a desire to share a lot of interesting options.  I told the gent I talked to tonight that I LOVE a place that has things that I haven't tried.  They have a lot of interesting stuff, and aim to bring in more.  They also have an extensive Off-Sale Bottle selection.  60-80.  They aim to get unique stuff.

If you liked Beer Hall and Hopwater Distribution, this is of that vein, and this is the new kid.  Oh, and the Bottle Shop on Telegraph too.  Liquid Gold is great.  They have a TON of potential to soon be the best.
author: Adam S.

description: Because you know you need a good craft beer after braving those long lines at Trader Joe's across the street. The draft list has 30 rotating taps and the beer fridge in the back has countless more options. Great chill vibe for Nob Hill and nice lighting for a date.
author: Andy L.

description: Cute little spot with a great beer selection. Plenty of options - there is something for everyone - with friendly service.
author: Emily F.

description:
We got the 4-beer flight for $12 (not including tip). They were:

Einstok - White
Pine street - Braindrops*
New Belgium - Hoptart
Avery - Ellie's brown*

I recommend the starred ones!
author: Vivian W.

description: Tried a delicious Punkuccino by the Seattle based brewery, Elysian. It was very good. The beer options here are definitely on the craft/micro brewery side but it's not intimiadting. The bar tender was very helpful and the place wasn't overly crowded at 10:00 on Friday night.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Two times being in San Francisco in the last couple weeks, two stops at Liquid Gold. 

First, I'll address the four-star instead of five-star rating. Would get five, but they charge you a "corking fee" for the beers they sell in the refrigerator. Not only do you make a profit in the price of the beer, but then you want to make a second profit for me drinking it. No. Not okay. 

Okay, I can proceed to my actual review. 

The beer they have there is a great mix of local and non-local brews, and the bartenders are extremely knowledgeable and willing to share their knowledge with you. I did a couple rounds of tasting flights, and he was willing to create a flight for me based on my tastes and preferences. All of the beers he picked were delicious. The next time I came I just picked my own, but it's nice to have such great folks who can help you on your way if you are a little lost or overwhelmed by the selection.

Insert old-lady comment here: I love how the electronic menu is easily changed and updated, but it's a little hard to see from all places in the bar. Maybe a chalkboard? Some cheap paper menus they can print easily?
author: Kristy C.

description:
After being spoiled by bomb breweries in San Diego for the past two years, I went on a quest to find good beer in SF. While this isn't a brewery, the fact that they served beer flights instantly appealed to me. It's a pretty small bar located in a quieter part of lower Nob Hill, not too far from the Tenderloin, so I could definitely see myself pregaming with beer here before heading down to bars on Polk. It wasn't packed when my friend and I arrived around 845 on a Friday night but more people came in later on - I liked that it never got overcrowded though. Pretty cool that they have a giant fridge of bottled beer (to be purchased?), a self-serve water station with glass cups, and Jenga! 

We both got flights of beer, which are $3/5oz for however many pours you want; certain beers are pricier as noted on the menu. Easily our favorite beer of the night was a Russian Imperial Stout from Half Moon Bay, which was a little thick with a rich chocolate/coffee flavor. I think it was on par with stouts I've sampled from Ballast Point in SD, and apparently very popular among other customers as well because they ran out by 10pm! I also liked the Belching Beaver peanut butter milk stout, another SD beer, which didn't have excessive peanut butter flavor. Every other drink we tried was pretty standard, nothing too special about them. The only one I didn't like was the Thirsty Bear Devil's Milkshake, which had a weird strawberry flavor, as if the sweetness had been watered down a lot. BUT the beers on tap are constantly changing so it's great that you can sample new beers at such a low price.

The storefront isn't very bright or recognizable but I guess that allows them to stay lowkey. Parking doesn't appear to be too difficult if you come early enough, but I would recommend uber/lyft/busing to stay on the safe side :) The bartenders are all super friendly and even struck up a conversation with us when he saw us playing pokemon LOL. I wish they served food (or bar snacks at least) but this is definitely the place to be if you wanna have a chill night or try out beers from a variety of breweries!
author: KC W.

description:
Beer Haven!

If you are wanna taste the exotic Craft Beers... This is the place to quench ya thurst for thirst.

"They shall hunger no more neither thirst anymore; neither shall the sun be thrust upon them nor any other heat."

(Not sure what the verse is a revelation of... But!)
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: Great service, great beer, and solid bottle selection! They have an amazing tap that rotates constantly w great breweries like modern times , avery, fieldwork, ballast point etc.  This place knows what's up!
author: Jesse C.

description:
You had me a "beer flights!"  (But they also made a boo-boo... more on that later.)  On the night we went, they had about 30 taps going, and several were wonderful.  Notes:

Yay:
- Ale industries Cherry Kush: a smooth, well-balanced fruit beer, better than the other fruity ones available. (And yes we tried them all!)
- Moonlight Reality Czech: yes, it's famous already... really tasty pilsner.
- Cismontane Belgian Dubbel: I don't usually go for the Belgians named multiples (multipels?) but this one was smooth and Chimayesque.
- Heretic Chocolate Hazelnut porter: neither of us tasted chocolate or hazelnuts... instead we got a strong taste of coffee - in a really well balanced beer.  More please.

Meh:
- Dogfish Head black and blue: way too funk / sharp for me.
- Almanac Farmer's reserve strawberry: not much taste other than overwhelming sourness - kind of like kombucha
- Altamont berry white: just OK, not a good balance of berry
- Berryessa Propaganda Pils
- Stillwater Stateside: Hoegaarden-y
- Evil Twin Soft dk:  it supposedly had vanilla but we mostly tasted the high alcohol content - 10.4% in an "imperial" stout.

Oh right, about that boo-boo: the beer I was most excited about - the faction chocolate milk stout - was listed on the online menu.  But the nitro machine was missing a part, said the bartender.  They hadn't had it all day.  :(  oops.
author: Aaron M.

description: Great service and great selection of beers. If you have something you're looking for, chances are, they'll have it or something similar. They also have a beer cooler in the back for beers to-go.
author: chad w.

description: Should eat before you come as they only provide maybe a small bag of beef jerky and their wide range of unique beers will most likely make you want to try more than one glass.  A cool ambiance with limited seating, but definitely a must try for any person interested in beer.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
have been waiting to try out this place for a while, and it certainly did not disappoint! came here with a friend to catch up over our new jobs on a sunday precisely at 2 pm when they opened.  fantastic - first pick of the seats at the bar.  they have a good amount of space, including a party table in the back, as well as a few spots by the entrance facing hyde street.  this is the perfect spot to relax before or after your trader joe's run, because it is literally across the street!

my friend is into darker brews, and he's been here before, so he knew right away what he wanted.  i went with a flight of 5 oz. tastes - an assortment of chocolate, milk, vanilla stouts.  i was clearly in that kinda mood! the staff were so so friendly and super knowledgeable, and were able to make great recommendations depending on what i had ordered/liked..! there are also bottles on bottles for sale in the fridge at the back, so dont forget to check that out.

i will FOR SURE be back again!  what a gem!
author: Christina L.

description:
Liquid Gold (LG) is all about craft brews and variety, meaning there's something for just about everyone's palate here! 

Visiting from the Mid-Atlantic region, where I'm spoiled because I can walk from my job to ChurchKey in D.C.'s Logan Circle, LG takes it to another level with two large fridges in the back. Those fridges house bottles of beer, wine and cider for sale -- take some things home or pop open and drink it there. Now, that's a beautiful thing...

The bar itself has a laid back, modern feel to it..and the decor stays true to its West Coast/SF roots. If you live in that neighborhood, I'm jealous. I saw some folks enjoying bottles in the back table with their toddlers, some folks watching a Ball game, others enjoying their friends and conversation. If your visiting, you must stop in.
author: Mike B.

description:
It's a nice neighborhood bar if you're in the area and want to meet someone for the first time off Tinder or OkCupid for a quick drink because it's not too crowded and not too loud. Also there are a lot of bar stools. Is that a weird example? Whatever. There's a pretty great beer selection for how tiny the bar is. It reminds me a bit of The Beer Hall at Polk and Market. Actually it reminds me of that place a lot. It's just far enough from the hustle and bustle of Polk, but just close enough that you can walk to a more crowded bar.

It's unfortunately only open until midnight, but that's just another reason why I think it would be great for a quick date / meet up. I had my Uber driver drop me off here, and he asked me if I was going to Trader Joe's. This was around 8 30 pm on a Saturday. No, sir, I am not. I am going to the bar across the street. But anyway, my point is that you can get drunk and eat snacks across the street at TJs! Yay!
author: Jennifer L.

description: LIQUID GOLD!!! Indeed (although I must say the belgian triple was a little too sweet for me)
author: CS R.

description:
I didn't know what to expect of this place since we only saw a review on Yelp. My wife likes to try new things on her birthday and that may occasionally have questionable results, but boy am I glad we came to this place. It was the best experience I've had at a bar/tasting room/pub ever (and believe me when I say I'm no stranger to those types of establishments). The owner (who shall remain nameless since he's too modest to tell you he's the owner) has set up the perfect environment for sampling and enjoying beer. The bartenders, Brandon and Janelle, are helpful and friendly. The selection of beer has something for everyone. I don't know how else to describe it, but it feels more like you went to your buddy's house for a few beers than going into a bar. We got recommendations and samples and could tailor our drinking any way we wanted. The other patrons at the bar were great too. It's a clean, hip, friendly, comfortable environment that I can't wait to return to. If you're uptight with a stick up your butt, leave it there. But if you're looking to have a good time, meet new people and learn something new, come here.

- Just realized this was unfinished in my Yelp app. So better a year late than never I guess.
author: Cliff W.

description:
Three times still a charm!!  First visit, came here to watch game #7 of the World Series. The intense then jubilant atmosphere was like nothing I've ever experienced, add to that, friendly knowledgable staff serving 30 locally brewed beers and selected wines.  Champagne was pouring the second Giants took the championship with a 3-2 win, CLASS!  You ask, what can beat that? Well....

2nd visit, 3 pm on a Monday afternoon!  The owner, Tim Lee greeted me warmly.  He was with a sales rep introducing selected wines from a winery in Paso Robles.  Being one of a few patrons in the bar (door just opened), Tim asked if I would like to participate in doing some tasting of the wines the sales rep brought.  An offer I cannot refuse! I love wine!! I got to taste one of their rare Chardonnay they sell on tap, a Cabernet and Sangiovese.  All delicious and tasty!  I hope Liquid Gold will be serving these wines in the future.

3rd visit, Friday night, me and a couple of girlfriends came here to have a few beers and wine before dinner.  They each had 2 beer flights.  A tasting of 4 different beers suggested by the knowledgeable staff depending on your taste.  I had their Cellars 33 Chardonnay on tap.  Loved it!  They even had a bubbly on the menu that night.  All tasty and delicious.  

I love the comfort of the bar.  Although I prefer the bar seats, they also offer a cozy couch and a long table with bench seating for bigger groups.  The vibrant atmosphere and decors from a map of San Francisco, "415" area code sign, to the black and white photos along the long wall of the bar gives it a "homey" feeling!  

Liquid Gold also offers "to go" beers.  They carry a huge selection of rare and specialty beers in their large refrigerator located in the back of the bar. The 30 beer taps and wine selections are changed constantly so I know I will be back for more tasting.
author: The Q.

description:
The only way I can think of to describe what I just experienced is to write about it. I'd call them but they're too busy. I looked up a few other sites like Twitter and Instagram but alas they can't do it justice. So I turn to Yelp.
I am not a regular at Liquid Gold but I stop in when I spot something interesting on their awesome tap list which is updated every day. 
Stopped in tonight for a Ballast Point tap takeover and Game 3 of the Warriors playoffs. Thoroughly enjoyed my flights of Ballast Point and some other amazing IPAs I've never heard of. 
Natalie (co owner) asked me if I'd tried the BBQ being offered by the door. I told her no and was not planning on trying it but decided I had no better options before I headed home so I decided to go for it.
The lady who cooks it is really nice. She loaded up a to go plate for me that must have weighed 4 lbs. When I got home I took my first bite and had a true foodgasm.
This was, without a doubt, the best BBQ I've ever had. I have not been to Texas and tried places like the Salt Lick or other highly rated Q places, but this must be as good. Everything was cooked absolutely perfect. You can taste the vinegar, sugar and whatever else is used in just the perfect amounts in each bite. Not too sweet, not too sour, just amazing. I had ribs, chicken, brisket, beans and collard greens. Even the greens had bits of meat in it which must be something you only see in the South because I've never seen it here. Ham hocks they may have been and man oh man was that good.
Shout out to LG: whoever she is needs her own restaurant. That was better than 4505 by far.
author: Matt H.

description: Came in for a Bikedog Brewing tap takeover kind of thing. We really loved the place. Parking was insane but I'm beyond taking off stars for that. The selection of brews was great and the folks working there were very friendly and helpful. The place has an excellent vibe. One small thing: I wish they'd give you a card or some way to label beers when you order a tasting. Easily fixable. Great spot!
author: Brian B.

description:
Great selection of beers, super friendly bartenders! If I were in SFO I would visit again. I got a flight of beer and one  bottle. The flight was bartender's choice and all of the beers were good. I was there on Friday last week. 
I didn't order pizza but you can also order pizza online with beer here. They don't make pizza in-house BTW, it is to be ordered online.
Unfortunately only open until midnight.
author: Abhi G.

description:
Been waiting for this wonderful gem to open and Liquid Gold gets two thumbs up from me. This hip and cool new hot spot offers an attentive and friendly staff along with 30 beers on tap! Featuring many from local breweries, including a small-production of wines and a few non-alcoholic selections for our DDs (Designated Drivers). The twist is that there is also beer available for off-site purchase

The space is balanced with a long L shape bar, cozy couch and communal table.

I've only had the privilege to try four different beers and look forward to come back and check out more local offerings and chatting it up with the locals.
author: Jess N.

description: Excellent selection of beer. 30 traps with a lot of great variety. Everything is available in a flight with varying prices.
author: Alysse F.

description: Great tasting craft beer and a ton choose from. Small and cozy, with limited seating.
author: Ilaria K.

description: It's a no-frills beer bar that might actually have too many taps. Luckily the staff are all very knowledgeable and can help you find something to your taste.
author: Kurt N.

description:
Nice new Taproom that i was able to enjoy a quick beer at while waiting for my friend to run an errand.

Looked like a great place to hangout and watch a game etc... 

Not to much to it though.

Seats, Bar and Beer. 

Will update again when i get to visit again.
author: Matthew M.

description: Beer drinkers heaven!! Great tap selection. Great selection to go! Friendly staff. I love this place!
author: Melanie B.

description:
It was a fun cool spot.
My boyfriend and I came in here late afternoon on Easter Sunday. We wanted a quick beer. Instead we tried 4 different kinds. It was nice and the bartender was very knowledgeable about the beers. He knew what he was talking about, which made it easier for us to pick our beers.
author: Flaca V.

description:
The selection here is amazing and the staff is super friendly as well as helpful. 

I assume that locals will be impressed with the diversity of beers and ciders, but for someone from across the country, it was a one-stop tour of some great west coast micro-breweries. 

I especially recommend the Santa Cruz Scrumpy Hard Pomegranate Cider!
author: Scott M.

description: Awesome selection of craft beer, and vibe! The beertender was very knowledgeable and helpful. I would definitely come back!
author: Casey Z.

description: I liked this place. It's clean, not overly crowded with hipsters, and their beer was good. They had a vast selection to cater to all types of people. I like lights, sours, and ciders and they were all very delectable. This place is super chill though, I can't stand going to a bar where I have to yell at the person I'm talking too. This place is intimate and really laid back. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Dara S.

description: Awesome service, great selection of beers that always change every week, and hardly ever packed. The staff are super knowledgeable about the beers and their selection of bottles is great!
author: Grant V.

description:
For a small bar, Liquid Gold has a really great feel to it - very chill and laid back. There are a couple nooks and crannies where a larger party can hang out and it wasn't overly crowded on a Friday night. That means that you can actually talk with your friends without screaming at them. And for sports lovers, they've also got a couple TVs that show the local teams.

The highlight, though, is their beer list and selection of bottles. As many people have mentioned, they have 30 taps and probably 100 different bottles. The quality of the selection is top notch. On the night I went, they had Founders Kentucky Breakfast Stout and Barrel Aged Speedway Stout on tap. Those are two of the harder beers to find, receiving scores of 100 and 99, respectively on beer advocate. That's like heaven for beer geeks!
author: Y K.

description: A little cozy neighborhood bar. Bring your laptop and stay for hours. Although I am not a beer drinker, they have an extensive menu that will satisfy every taste.
author: Kajal P.

description:
Beer flights are a really amazing price and the selection is AMAZEBALLS. 

Words can't describe how amazing I feel this place is. I came during 7pm on a Friday. It was pretty empty and it was also a pretty nice noise level (quiet).

The service was also really nice and pretty attentive. There was also a lot of insight on the selection too.

The fridges in the back also house beer bottles and cans you can purchase to consume in-house or to keep. Reasonably priced and a fairly good selection with some unique nuggets in there.

10/10 would come back and would bring people here.

Sidenote: If they run out of a tap, they'll rotate it with another tap. If they run out of the second tap, they'll rotate in another barrel of the first tap.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Small, cozy with somewhat uncomfortable seating. Doesn't matter. This place is awesome, and you should go if you're into good beer. Excellent selection and good vibe
author: Phoebe C.

description: Super sweet beer selection...it's hard to have the same beer twice. Love it for selection. Hard place to belly up for awhile but is good for a quick, tasty two.
author: Rob L.

description:
Well, of course Liquid Gold deserves 5 stars - a perfect Nob Hill bar. 

I first came to Liquid Gold for their grand opening, I had no idea what to expect as the name confused me. I am beyond happy that I decided to go, I fell in love at first sight. Located right opposite Trader Joes, it may be a little hard to miss as it is tucked away between store fronts. The Gold signage should catch your eye along with their large windows. 

Here are many reasons why I love this spot: 
1) The owners are AMAZING, they are so nice and friendly.. they make this place what it is. Tim is so nice and we were able to have several conversations with him about the business. They made my friends and I feel so special and welcome, and always remember us! Perfect example of how bars should be. 
2) Beverages: They have beer and Wines from all over the Bay Area, the Bartenders can recommend beers that you may like. The first time I asked for the beer tasting of 4 beers and told them to choose for me.  They also have beer and wine for purchasing at the back, just like a store - genius. 
3) Snacks and bar food: When we first started coming here, they would give our free popcorn, chocolates, and trail mix.. not sure about now but boy, that was a treat. They have bar food from the Chinese restaurant next door, i HIGHLY recommend the salt & pepper wings. Because of Liquid Gold, I eat at the Chinese restaurant often. 
4)Crowd - Everyone wears plaid here, so i recommend investing in a plaid shirt and popping in. Great crowd, very laid back. 

They also have TV's here, great place to watch the game. I watched the World Series here and they gave everyone free champagne after the big win. 

Yesterday (2/12) they had a food pop-up, they were selling bread pudding (YUM), pork noodles, beef jerky, and another item. 

As you can tell, YOU have to check out to this place. I walked by here with a coworker and his exact words were, "This is exactly what Nob Hill needed". One of my favorite spots in the city. See you soon, Liquid Gold!!
author: Natasha S.

description: Great little bar great beer list, 30 taps. Second visit. Staff very friendly and honest! My girlfriend left her Canon SLR camera (worth a few dollars) on New Year's Eve and staff (ROSIE) kept it for her. Very grateful.
author: John H.

description: Solid beer bar in the Nob Hill Area. Decent tap selection and not super crowded.
author: Rohan D.

description: Hits and misses abound here. Some solid stuff mostly in the appetizers but the mains can be not as described. Wonderful atmosphere, space and the staff is great.
author: Nicolas P.

description:
They have 30 different types of Beer on Tap, and another 50 in the fridge!  Nice Space and Nice owners!

- It's Really Good!
author: J Y.

description: Great beer and many sections for cider (which is my personal preference). Friendly employees!
author: Jacqulynn O.

description: Liquid gold is my most favorite bar in the whole city. They have a great selection of beer and the place is super chill. Connect4 on a Sunday with my favorite stout is the best way to spend the weekend. Tim, his wife and all the bartenders are super sweet and always really helpful when I want to try something new. 5 stars cuz this place is solid gold ;)
author: Melanie C.

description: I discovered this place on Instagram, I've been wanting to check it out for a while. Went for the first time on Friday night (3/18). Nice interior; feels very good, super long bar. The beer selection was incredible! Lots of interesting brews of all type with good descriptions on the very detailed electronic menu board. Unfortunately, the robot like staff was completely devoid of any personality whatsoever (at least the two I dealt with). Hopefully it was just a bad night, I will definitely go back again.
author: Tom M.

description: Liquid Gold is an excellent spot to enjoy great beer and the Nob Hill neighborhood.  The selection on tap is solid with many high quality local options and the bottle selection is very good.  Low corkage fee as well.  The space is clean, simple and slightly modern.  The staff is friendly, helpful and knowledgable.  Definitely worth a visit.
author: N Y.

description:
Finally, it's open!   When I first went to Mikkeller bar, just after it opened, I was incensed at the frou frou glasses beer was served in.  Beer in wine glases...   Age teaches you many things (if you're willing to learn, or else you become one of those horrid old men walking down the street cursing the world, aloud) and one of them is to recognize an Issue, and when to simply accept that something isn't going away.  Frou frou beer glasses aren't going away.  I'm not even going to waste time on the idea.  Liquid Gold is one of those new beer bars with Frou Frou glasses.

Lots of beer to choose from, from several taps behind the bar---although they don't produce any of their own, and I didn't notice any cask capacity, and didn't think to inquire.  I confined myself to IPAs, amazed to discover the range available just in that one style---and one I thought I knew!  The staff, one of which was the owner, was quite friendly, pleasant, and easy to talk to.  And it turned out that one of our bar stool neighbors was an employee of Drakes, and so even more beer knowledge was available for the asking.   All in all a very fine afternoon, and then, as we left, around five, the bar began to fill up.

It's a long, narrow space with high ceilings, bar on one side, bathroom and cooler in the rear.  It's all done in a battle ship gray paint, with a vinyl coated wood bar that looks gray as well.  The cooler is amply stocked with bottles of beer, not limited to that which is on tap...

And that is the one gripe I have with this bar.

Wine is available ONLY by the bottle.  And if you buy wine, or beer by the bottle,  you have to pay a corkage fee as well.  Now why is this?   Corkage fees exist to allow businesses to make some money off of those who insist on bringing their own wine to a restaurant, and to discourage customers from doing so, especially this close to wine country.  Why is a bar that is selling beer, and wine by the bottle, with its own mark-up, also adding a corkage fee?  I don't understand, and I DON'T like it.  I'd take away a star if there wasn't so much beer available on tap, such that I don't see any need to buy a bottle.   If this wasn't a Beer Bar, I'd also be miffed that I can't order wine by the glass, but it is a Beer Bar so expecting wine is something like eschewing Rum at a tiki bar.

So, all is well and I wish this bar good success and hope to make it one of my haunts.
author: Paul T.

description:
Great bar with paddles of beer. Plus you can buy bottled beer and wine here and pay a corkage fee or take it home. 

Huge selection! Get a seat at the table in the back of you can to play some board games while you enjoy your beer tastings. 

The bar staff can be a bit rude but I have noticed them to be nice to the people who come in often as some of my friends do. Their puddles were served with the type of beer written on a post-it while ours were left to mystery. This would have been find had I ordered my own paddle. A friend had gotten mine so I could save our spot at the table as it was beginning to get crowded for the night. 

I did have a coffee beer that was fabulous and would live to tell you all about but I'm unsure of what beers I was drinking. I will have to check the menu if I ever find myself back here. 

The bar is very clean, and well decorated at that so if you are looking to beer taste in the city Liquid Gold is a viable option.
author: Kristin F.

description:
Liquid Gold is a great neighborhood beer bar and shop, located on Hyde. Our crowd of 4 people found an easy spot to settle for a nightcap. The space is basically long and narrow-- the bar itself runs along a majority of the right wall, with a majority of seats along the bar. I don't know if this would be the best spot for a large group-- we were there on a Thursday evening, so the crowd situation was very easy to manage. However, I couldn't imagine a group of 6+ people being able to sit comfortably and converse as a group.

As you would guess, they have a great selection of beers on tap, as well as an extensive fridge of bottled beer. A digital menu shows their offerings, although I found it a bit difficult to read (Perhaps I'm getting old). 

We only stayed for one drink, and "last call" was announced around 10:30, so this isn't a late-night spot, but more of a post-dinner spot.  I didn't take tons of time to peruse, but the bottled beer selection was extensive. I can imagine that it serves the Nob/Russian hill clientele very well-- especially after shopping at Trader Joe's across the street.
author: Bryan B.

description: Very friendly staff. Anxious to educate and allow us the tastings to enjoy.  Was taking a long walk from Union Square for dinner. Good 1/2 way point to enjoy a break and lovin the selection of kind beers, ales, IPA, and the sampler (flights) are a great way to taste a few.
author: Anthony L.

description:
Wow...what an awesome addition to Nob Hill! 
Walking by on Hyde Street today, this place caught my eye... the decor is neat, the ambiance is chill & the owner is a great guy! The bar wasn't open when I was walking by, but the owner Tim was there & I got to talk to him about the bar...he's awesome. I really want to see this new addition to Nob Hill make it, so my husband & I will be sure to check it out this weekend. 

Spread the word, I bet this place is going to quickly be a great spot to enjoy beer!! MANY beers...as I think he said they have 30 beers on tap & several more bottled brands. They also had bottles of wine. 
(**They had several large tv's for those who want to catch a game) 

Let's Welcome Liquid Gold to the neighborhood!

Good Luck!
author: SF M.

description:
As a big fan of craft beer, I was excited about this place months before it even opened. Obviously my expectations were high, but fortunately for me this place met - nay - EXCEEDED them.

Liquid Gold not only has excellent selection of local beers on tap, but they have several fridges of tall boys to buy and carry out OR enjoy right there at the bar (with corkage fees of course). Many of the beers I saw in the fridges I have never seen elsewhere too, which gives this place some serious points.

If you like City Beer Store, then you'll enjoy this place as well. CBS may have a larger selection of purchasable beers, but Liquid Gold has a better draft line in my opinion. Also, pound for pound (drop for drop?) I think LG has a better selection of beer given their space.

Finally, the owner, Tim, seems like a very genuine guy. He's always been exceedingly friendly, helpful and very willing to bring in beer that you want to see on his shelves. He's a local boy, too, so you know he's got his finger on the pulse of the beer industry of the area.

Final word: Liquid Gold is exactly what this neighborhood needed!
author: Brendan B.

description:
So my coworkers and I are always looking for a chill spot to drink, get beer bites and try new beers. This place was an amazing recent discovery! They always have 30 beers on tap and they rotate with new ones EVERY DAY. 
If that doesn't top it off the finger food, although limited in selection, is damn good and Tim the owner is always happy to recommend a beer that goes well with your selection. 
Lastly, the fridge section with micro brews available for purchase will keep my liver busy for a while.
Highly recommended!
author: Jin C.

description:
Welcome to the neighborhood!  Thanks Tim, Michael, & Natalie we had a great time last night.  Will be back often, perfect pit stop before or after grocery shopping at Trader Joe's across the street.

30 craft beers on tap, mostly local and constantly rotating.  Also have a great selection of bottles in the back for drinking on the spot or take'em home.  Staff is extremely friendly and very knowledgeable.  Several good TVs for watching sports too

Glad it finally opened, looking forward to swinging by regularly.
author: Brooks R.

description:
I was a little worried this new, hip spot would be way too crowded on a Saturday night but lucky for us it was lively but not unmanageable. Crossing my fingers it stays a chill spot for locals.

Reasons to like Liquid Gold:
Great local beer selection on tap
Awesome cider select on tap (Sonoma Cider is my new favorite)
Bright, clean decor that welcomes you instantly
Dope glasses with the bar's name adorned
Take out fridges in the back for when you need to pack a tasty doggie bag
author: Rachel R.

description: Huge fan of this spot. Great selection of draft and bottled/canned beer. Staff knows their stuff about beer without being pretentious, and they're always willing to give free tastes. Just a great place to have some great beer.
author: Brian R.

description:
Take flight.

Never gets old: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IAmsHbAA6c0

Never will get old: $12 for a flight of four beers. Ciders, lights, darks and everything in between. Not being a beer connoisseur had to trust the staff to choose well. They did.

Bar seating dominates this otherwise minimally designed new spot. Enthusiastic staff adds an extra energy to the experience.

Might become a frequent flyer.
author: Jason B.

description: The selection and the atmosphere was great the bartender was a cute down to earth intelligent girl which knew the area and bit recommended some cool spots to visit. Will definitely come back when I visit SF California again.
author: Angel R.

description:
Never had cherry cider until this place! The great thing is: you can get a small pour to try it out, so you're not stuck with a full glass if you don't like it. But hey! I liked it! Never saw it on a menu before, so had to try it.

Anyway, not a big space, but great neighborhood spot.
author: Riz W.

description:
Really love this space and the selection.  That being said, it's really small, and no liquor license(so only beer).

Highly recommended!
author: Yan L.

description:
Usually love this place - great selection and friendly staff. 

But refusing to play NCAA games during March Madness...???  Serious thumbs down
author: Stacey R.

description: Such a good addition to the neighborhood. The servers were very friendly and knowledgable and all the beers on tap were amazing. 30 beers on tap! Will definitely be coming back!
author: Mel S.

description: This neighborhood joint is finally open, and I've been happy on both visits. As a genuine bottle shop, you can both drink/taste on premises and buy things you like to take home. They serve lots of regional and local selections, as well as some snacks. Beer flights are available, and you can choose whatever you'd like in yours.
author: David S.

description: This bar is amazing! Not only can you get a great selection from the beer flights, but you can now order pizza on demand! When you are at the bar, go to Redpie.co, and in less than 30 minutes you can have hot, delicious pizza with your beer. It is a great combination especially since Liquid Gold doesn't offer pizza. I will be coming here much more often!
author: Jillian A.

description: Clean, normal, chill, well-run, and pretty aloha to boot.
author: John M.

description: 30 different beers on tap with options for flights. This is a great spot for a casual beer and if you like the beer, they have a long fridge of beers that you can find your beer in and purchase. I kinda wish they had some bar snacks to buy, but there are plenty of spots around to grab food as well
author: Alex S.

description: I discovered this place on Instagram, I've been wanting to check it out for a while. Went for the first time on Friday night (3/18). Nice interior; feels very good, super long bar. The beer selection was incredible! Lots of interesting brews of all type with good descriptions on the very detailed electronic menu board. Unfortunately, the robot like staff was completely devoid of any personality whatsoever (at least the two I dealt with). Hopefully it was just a bad night, I will definitely go back again.
author: Tom M.

description: If you are looking for a chill atmosphere with friendly bartenders and great beer, I definitely recommend this place. I ordered a couple of beers before observing a beer platter they offer, and was not disappointed; it's a great way to sample 4 different beers, without committing to a single pallet. The interior is well done with adequate lightning and an ample amount of room. It your looking for a club, this is not it. If you want to experience delicious beer tasting with friends, this is one of those hidden gems of the city.
author: Alex S.

description: My favorite place to grab a brew or three in the city. Impressive selection, clean atmosphere, can have a conversation inside the place, and friendly people behind the bar. Also great fridge. I am very lucky to live next to this bar.
author: Max C.

description:
TONs of beer bottles and on tap. 

Bartenders are friendly and allow you to try different types before selecting. 

Also have several TV's if you want to watch the game.
author: Jonathan H.

description: Came here on my last day visiting the awesome city of SF and liquid gold definitely did not disappoint. Coming from San Diego, where I've been spoiled in regards to craft beer, I have pretty high expectations when evaluating a beer bar and they were all exceeded here. Friendly bar tender, cool interior and setup, and amazing selection. About 30 taps and a huge selection of bottles. If your a craft beer geek looking for an awesome beer bar in SF, make sure you give this place a visit.
author: Ulysses G.

description:
Great experience for an out-of-towner looking for the best beer selection in SF. Friendly and informative staff. Beers on tap offered a great variety. The flight was perfect for me.

Even grabbed a few bottles from the cooler in the back on the way out - too much good stuff to pass on.
author: Jay N.

description: Cool taproom, solid selection of beers, loving the fridge!
author: Jay K.

description: Great spot. Has a great varied beer selection. I especially like that it's not just the boring double IPAs, pale ales and golden ale of many other bars. I love strong, dark complex, and sometimes high alchohol brews from creative breweries. Ones that can blend spices, do Belgian reds, smoked ales, etc. This place has that range where I can experiment with a flight or bottles each time. Had a great vanilla chestnut from Heretic last time. Friendly staff and not too crowded as well
author: andrew s.

description: The chocolate milk beer they have here was awesome.  This place had a great atmosphere and plenty of beers to try.  The corking fees for beer and wine made us not even consider those, so we stuck with what was on tap.  We tried to go here another time but they were closed.  If we came back to San Francisco, we would totally check out this place again.
author: Leala E.

description: Love this place! The selection of beer is vast and the place is chic. Our bartender wasn't particularly helpful when we asked her about the menu (we went some months ago), but they were closing up so I get that. Can't wait to try the flight the next time we go back!
author: Jen H.

description: Great selection of beers here, we had a great time exploring the menu. Came in here on a Friday and they had an all-day happy hour going for $1 off all of their beer and wine on tap, awesome! Paying $5-$8 for some great beer in the middle of Nob Hill, tough to beat.
author: Brian W.

description: Like beer? They have a very nice selection that changes weekly. Get your tastes buds on walk up the hills that get your heart pumping and cool off will a glass of your liking  from liquid gold. Strictly beer no hard liquor or wine but it's still such a good place. They also have fridges where you can purchase bottles to take home. Love it. Come here a couple of time a month with some coworkers and it's always a pleasure. They also have connect four, Jenga and other card games to keep you entertained.
author: Vanessa G.

description: Great little bar with a superb beer selection.  A lot like city beer, but a bit more updated and has a really sleek style to it.  The bartender tonight was super pleasant and a pleasure to order from.
author: Anand A.

description:
stupid loud, they just opened and at 3 in the afternoon it was irritating to be there.
No excuse, acoustical treatments are cheap, we were excited, and walked from BART to check it out, it was a miserable environment, left, as Mikkeller is many times nicer and even cheaper.
author: Charles K.

description: Fantastic beer selection.  Try the New Belgium / Rare Barrel collab Err on the Side of Awesome. Brandon is a great bartender.
author: David C.

description:
Been here a few times now with my girlfriend. Great selection of choice local brews, friendly, conversational staff and solid layout. For that, I really want to give five stars but kept it at three due to being priced higher than it should. 

Basically all pours are 12 oz. (believe there may be a couple that are 10 oz.). Totally get that--some beers, whether due to rarity, high ABV, ingredients etc. are going to be different prices and different size pours. The issue here is the brews that are more widely produced (and retail for $8 a six-pack) should be a $5 or $6 16 oz. pint and instead are a $7 or $8 12 oz. pour. 

End of the world? Absolutely not; especially considering some of the great beers they bring in. But in general, it's priced too high for me to be able to go as much as I do other places of its ilk. Being a brand new place, there's a chance those prices dip down once they establish themselves and build revenue.

At any rate, a very nice addition to the neighborhood and worth checking out.
author: Steve B.

description: This is definitely my favorite neighborhood bar! I went to their opening weekend and have been going back every few weeks since then. The owners are super friendly and always recognizes me and my friends each time which obviously makes us feel really warm and fuzzy. The beer/wine on tap are great and local. It's just a great place to unwind after work or if you're in the mood to be social but don't want to do anything crazy.
author: Patty K.

description: Great place and huge selection of beer. The owner was very nice, informative, and just generally great to talk to. Highly recommend stopping in and trying some new beers.
author: Chris B.

description: Brandon and Alex are so sweet and knowledgeable about beers. LOVE THEM! Also the Baltic porter is amazing.
author: L C.

description: Cool, small bar. Lots of microbrews. If they don't have it on tap they'll have it bottled in the cooler. It's small and besides the bar they only have one table and a couch.
author: Frank A.

description: Awesome place great atmosphere amazing beer selection and the owner is one cool dude. Come check this place out you will not be disappointed
author: Alex P.

description: I recently moved here from Chicago and found this craft beer bar while shopping at TJ's.  I'm so glad I did because this has become one of my new favorite bars.  They have a great selection of local beers on tap and a bottle shop with all domestic beers towards the rear. I've been here a few time already and the menu is always different.  I'm a huge IPA fan and the salt & pepper chicken wings pair perfectly with it.  Friendly staff too and they let you sample before you buy!
author: Ryan O.

description: Great beer choices with the option for a sampler flight. Clean and plenty of room at the bar. Popcorn available for a quick snack. A new favorite in the hood.
author: Sandra G.

description: Awesome beer selection, both on tap and in the fridges. Like City Beer Store, you can take a bottle from there to go or they'll pour it for you on the spot. The noise level was also great, as it wasn't quiet but not so loud that you had to tell to be heard. They also have a few random board games for patrons which seemed like a nice twist.
author: Vinay B.

description:
Liquid Gold is worth a visit - it's a neighborhood gem! The beer selection on tap is fantastic - it's hard to choose and I'll need to keep coming back many times to fully appreciate all the unique beers. The ambiance is modern, with a TV beer menu that stays up to date. You'll get poured in a custom glass appropriate for each type of beer, and the staff is very knowledgable about the selection and gave me  great recommendations.

It's usually not too crowded and a perfect place to meet up in the neighborhood. The long bar offers plenty of low key and comfortable seating, and Liquid Gold is amazingly clean unlike other nearby bars. There are lots of TVs to catch games and there is a mini lounge area near the back so walk through to see if that's open. There is light snack food too. 

Will definitely come back again!
author: Steve P.

description: Great beer selection and its great to get flights here! Very conveniently located by Trader Joes and always feels welcoming. They gave me a peanut butter chocolate with my peanut butter beer, which I enjoyed very much.
author: Stuart T.

description: Beer flights make me happy, so I am a fan. HOWEVER, there is no food and this place is rather tight fitted. All in all just an A-Ok or me.
author: Brittini S.

description: This place is awesome with a great selection of beers! The atmosphere is relaxed and an overall great place to relax and wind down the day before heading home.
author: bella k.

description: This place was awesome! The service and beers were top notch! We were here for the SF Beer Run Kickoff party, otherwise we wouldn't have ever known about it. My girlfriend and I tried a bunch of different beers here, her favorite was the White Belgian Passionfruit and mine was the Fort Point Rye Pale Ale. FYI there is no food here, but there are a couple places nearby that you can go to, get something, and bring back to the bar.
author: Kris R.

description: Incredible beer selection- they have any variety you could ever want! Friendly staff and you can order Chinese food from the restaurant next door. Love this place!
author: Eric S.

description: Love this place, Tim's awesome, bartenders are very knowledgeable. Great selection! Will come back again
author: Richard G.

description: This place is the best! Service is always top notch and the beer selection is on point. Highly recommend!!
author: Jordan K.

description: Awesome place! Very well decorated and the beers they offer are phenomenal. I'm so happy this place is in my neighborhood. Check them out if you are looking for delicious and interesting beers.
author: Brian W.

description: Finally there is a place to hang out and enjoy the beers, they have different types of beer on tap and bottles, I don't have to drive from one brewery to another, one stop to try more than 30 types, great place to bring friends out of town, Happy Happy
author: J L.

description: I dig this place. Tons of great beers on tap...and you can play jenga. Win win.
author: Shannon B.

description: This has now become my favorite place in the city to grab a drink. The staff is friendly and well versed about the beer they carry. I love that all the beers are local brews and the ambiance pays homage to San Francisco.  The best part is that I can grab a pack from the coolers and go if I'm on the run.  The owner is extremely friendly and it's impossible to leave without feeling glad you came.
author: Melanie V.

description: great selection of local beers and friendly bartenders!
author: Li L.

description: Really enjoyed the friendly service and expansive menu. Comfortable space and good mixed crowd. Definitely will be back.
author: TK M.

description: Just a fantastic place to go if you love beer. 30 taps and so many interesting unheard of beers to choose from. A large space and they have a fridge in back with even more beers that you can take to go! One of the very few bars where you can do that in the city. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Their prices are fair - don't come here if you want a cheap and widely available pint. The Hydeout is a few doors down if that's what you're into. Highly recommended.
author: Paul d.

description: If you want to taste local beer and receive outstanding customer service, this is the best place to be in town! Definitely worth trying!
author: Andrea Z.
